description:
Never-married children living in families
(traditional family concept)

Explanatory notes for the following statistics:
12211 Microcensus

Definition:
Never-married persons who live with their parents or with
one parent, e.g. their divorced mother, in a household or in
a family. There is no age limit for being counted as a
child. Never-married stepchildren, adopted and foster
children are also regarded as children provided that the
above conditions are met.


© Statistisches Bundesamt, Wiesbaden 2017
name: Never-married children in families (trad.fam.conc)
